lines.text:
[voiceover]
Who is to say what is a sin in God's eyes.
My father died before I reached my teens. Some say that was a punishment. My mother never remarried or loved another. Some say THAT was a punishment.

[in labor]
Are you sure God's not punishing me?
To be sure he's punishing you, woman. He be giving you a child.
I wonder if existance as a woman is worthwhile at all.

[the elder is about to pin the A on her blousse]
Why do you wait? Put it on, for it is not a badge of my sin but your own.
I have dreamed of speaking my heart, I have prayed for it even as I have dreaded it. Was I alive before I laid eyes on thee?
Has this new land turned thee into a heathen?
[to the crowd gathered for Hester's hanging]
In God's eyes, I am her husband.
So... you fucked a minister, eh? Oh, what my father would pay for THAT priceless morsel!
